citations.narrative:
- A procedure as part of a protocol involving prairie voles was performed on 22 March 2024. The procedure was planned
to be a survival surgery involving two voles followed by administration of long term pain medication. The pain medication
would allow for data collection to take place over the next couple of days, after which the voles would be humanely
euthanized. At the end of the surgical procedure, laboratory personnel discovered that there was an insufficient amount of
pain medication on hand. The technician consulted with the primary investigator and was directed to humanely euthanize
the voles while under anesthesia due to concerns about post operative pain. There was no attempt to contact the
Attending Veterinarian for the facility.
Laboratory personnel failed to assure that appropriate pain medication was available before starting the surgical
procedure, and further failed to consider contacting the Attending Veterinarian to request support or guidance. Inadequate
or incomplete training of laboratory personnel can have a significant impact on the health and welfare of research
animals. The facility must ensure that all personnel involved in animal care are fully trained and qualified to perform their
duties.
Correct from 2 August 2024 onward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
